task: Two nearby lampposts are perpendicular to the ground, which is flat. One of the lampposts is 15 feet tall and has a shadow that is 6 feet long. At the same time, the shadow of the other lamppost is 5 feet long. How tall, in feet, is the other lamppost? (Assume that at a given point in time, the right triangles formed by the lampposts and their respective shadows are similar.)
explanation:
The correct answer is 12.5. Since the triangles are similar, the proportion is:
15/6 = x/5.
Solving for x gives: x = (15 × 5) / 6 = 12.5 feet.
